problem.display_name: Graded question - Numerator Quality Parameters - Question 2
problem.markdown:
"A = B" means what in terms of the configuration of the WHO Data Quality Tool?
>>Select the one correct answer: (2 attempts) <<
( ) A. You only want to see indicator from group A and group B ( ) B. It means that indicator A is greater than indicator B (x) C. It means that indicator A should be roughly equal to indicator B ( ) D. It does not mean anything
[explanation] It means that indicator A should be roughly equal to indicator B is correct. [explanation]

multiplechoiceresponse.p: "A = B" means what in terms of the configuration of the WHO Data Quality Tool?
multiplechoiceresponse.label: Select the one correct answer: (2 attempts)

choicegroup.choice: A. You only want to see indicator from group A and group B
B. It means that indicator A is greater than indicator B
C. It means that indicator A should be roughly equal to indicator B
D. It does not mean anything

div.p: It means that indicator A should be roughly equal to indicator B is correct.
